column1: Cri du chat syndrome is a group of symptoms that result from missing a piece of chromosome number 5.

Symptoms include: - Cry that is high-pitched and may sound like a cat - Downward slant to the eyes - Low birth weight and slow growth - Low-set or abnormally shaped ears - Intellectual disability - Partial webbing or fusing of fingers or toes - Single line in the palm of the hand - Skin tags just in front of the ear - Slow or incomplete development of motor skills - Small head (microcephaly) - Small jaw (micrognathia) - Wide-set eyes
The health care provider will perform a physical exam.
Your provider will suggest ways to treat or manage the symptoms.
Parents of a child with this syndrome should have genetic counseling and testing to determine if one parent has a change in chromosome 5.
Half of children with this syndrome learn enough verbal skills to communicate.
